intro: Pachecoa venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan pachecoa, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
